thread.title: This dedicated Trump supporter couldn’t wait for inauguration day | New York Post
thread.title_full: This dedicated Trump supporter couldn’t wait for inauguration day | New York Post

author: Erik Blades
title: This dedicated Trump supporter couldn’t wait for inauguration day | New York Post

persons.name: rob cortis william c. lopez one donald trump

text:
Rob Cortis William C. Lopez One Donald Trump supporter kicked off the inaugural parade four days early, cruising around Midtown hauling a homemade float celebrating the next president.
Rob Cortis calls his creation the Trump Unity Bridge and says he has hauled it behind his SUV all around the country from his home in Michigan.
He claims he has covered some 7,000 miles, including down to Florida, where he met with members of the Trump family at The Donald’s Mar-a-Lago club in Palm Beach.
The float features signs emblazoned with Trump-themed slogans, such as Making America Great Again.
Cortis’ next stop is Washington, DC, for the inauguration on Friday.
